function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Biophilic design may be misinterpreted or misapplied, leading to ineffective implementation of nature-based elements in architecture.","Impact":"Reduced psychological and physiological health benefits, diminished cognitive functionality and performance.","Mitigation":"Education and training on biophilic design principles and the importance of nature in architecture; consultation with biophilic design experts.","Technologies":"Biophilic design software and simulation tools for testing and optimizing nature-based architectural elements.","People":"Architects, designers, and developers.","Owner":"Architecture firms, design companies, and construction firms."},{"Description":"Inadequate incorporation of nature-based elements in architecture may result in a lack of human-nature connection and reduced well-being for building occupants.","Impact":"Decreased psychological and physiological health, impaired cognitive functionality and performance, diminished sense of well-being.","Mitigation":"Collaboration with environmental psychologists and biophilic design experts to ensure meaningful integration of natural elements; post-occupancy evaluations to assess the impact on occupants.","Technologies":"Biophilic design assessment tools and sensor technologies for monitoring the impact of natural elements on occupants.","People":"Building occupants, residents, and users.","Owner":"Building owners, property developers, and facility managers."},{"Description":"Failure to consider the cultural and ecological context of natural elements in biophilic design may lead to insensitivity or disconnection with the local environment and community.","Impact":"Loss of cultural relevance, potential harm to local ecosystems, alienation of community members.","Mitigation":"Engagement with local stakeholders and indigenous communities to understand the cultural significance of natural elements; ecological impact assessments and sustainable design practices.","Technologies":"Geospatial mapping tools for analyzing local ecological features and historical/cultural significance; virtual reality simulations for community engagement and feedback.","People":"Local communities, indigenous groups, environmental activists.","Owner":"Architects, developers, and urban planners."}]}
